newsitem.title: CANADA: WCE canola ends down on hedges, local selling.
newsitem.headline: WCE canola ends down on hedges, local selling.

text.p: WCE canola and flax futures ended down on hedges and local selling, traders said.
"Dominion Securities sold 125 March and 50 May canola and locals covered shorts. XCan bought Jan scale down, Cargill bought March scale down," a trader said.
January futures crush profit margin rose to -37.80 from -39.67 Monday based on January soyoil and meal.
January canola fell $1 to $407.40 a tonne and March fell $0.80 to $408.60. January flax lost $1.80 to $364.50 on hedge and commercial selling met by short covering. Volume was 163.
February western barley lost $2 to $139.60 as Midland Walwyn sold more than 300 contracts, Cargill sold at $140, traders said. Volume was 1,200 lots.
December feed wheat fell $0.70 to $171.50 on long liquidation, March rose $0.70 to $174 on UGG demand, floor sources said. Dec-Mar spread $2.50, traders said. Volume was 735.
RBCDS sold 10 December feed peas up US$2.50 at US$206, traders said.
(All values in Canadian dollars except peas, oats).
